fields.title: The Godfather
fields.review: A beautifully crafted gangster film. An amazing period piece. A character study.

fields.title: The Shawshank Redemption
fields.review: A beloved, incessantly revisited, stone-cold classic.

fields.title: Divergent
fields.review: This is a rite-of-passage film, with action, romance and self-realization woven in.

fields.title: Insurgent
fields.review: The film's inability to stand out resulted in a story that feels bland and lifeless.

fields.title: The Fault in Our Stars
fields.review: This film could indeed become this generation's Love Story -- mildly implausible, but genuinely moving.

fields.title: Paper Towns
fields.review: Hollywood can surprise us and serve up an honest, funny, entertaining, and endearing film.

fields.title: Inception
fields.review: Mind-blowing, amazing, smart, thrilling. That's all.

fields.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
fields.review: A sensitive film that doesn't fall into triteness.

fields.title: Minions: The Rise of Gru
fields.review: A frequently funny, handsomely animated and generally enjoyable movie.

fields.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
fields.review: The spontaneous cheers in the cinema for Spider-Man: No Way Home were well worth it.
